Package school

Class SchoolAPI

java.lang.Object
school.SchoolAPI
public class SchoolAPI extends Object
Interface for accessing information derived from the school json file. This includes things like time remaining, upcoming periods, and the current period. More data is available from the other classes in this package, but it is avised to use this API instead

  • Constructor Details

    • SchoolAPI

      public SchoolAPI(String jsonName) throws FileNotFoundException
      Constructs a new SchoolAPI object with a specified json file name.
      Parameters:
      jsonName - the name of the json file. No path should be specified. All json files are expected to be at the location described by SchoolJson.EXPECTED_PATH as an artifact in the jar file.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the json file does not exist.
      IllegalArgumentException - if any json parse error occurs.
      See Also:
      • SchoolYear

    • SchoolAPI

      public SchoolAPI(String jsonName, Map<String,List<Map<String,String>>> days) throws FileNotFoundException
      Constructs a new SchoolAPI object with a specified json file name.
      Parameters:
      jsonName - the name of the json file. No path should be specified. All json files are expected to be at the location described by SchoolJson.EXPECTED_PATH as an artifact in the jar file.
      days - an optional parameter to manually specify the definition of each day type for the given school (e.g. for the college/university format). If this argument is not null, it will be used in place of any "Days" definition in the json file.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the json file does not exist.
      IllegalArgumentException - if any json parse error occurs.
      See Also:
      • SchoolYear

  • Method Details

    • getTimezone

      public String getTimezone()
      Returns the timezone of the loaded school json file as a Unix timezone identifier (e.g. "America/Los_Angeles" for much of the west coast of the United States).

      This method is a wrapper for accessing SchoolYear::getTimezone.

      Returns:
      the timezone of the loaded school json file as a Unix timezone identifier.

    • getFirstPeriod

      public int getFirstPeriod()
      Returns the first possible period number.

      This method is a wrapper for accessing SchoolYear::getFirstPeriod.

      Returns:
      the first possible period number

    • getLastPeriod

      public int getLastPeriod()
      Returns the last possible period number.

      This method is a wrapper for accessing SchoolYear::getLastPeriod.

      Returns:
      the last possible period number

    • getCurrentPeriod

      public SchoolPeriod getCurrentPeriod(UTCTime now)
      Returns the SchoolPeriod object such that start <= now <= end. Note that the definition of a period runs from the start to the end, inclusive on both sides. This is because the end time is 1 millisecond before the period trasition (e.g. 13:59:59.999 for a period where the bell rings at 14:00).
      Parameters:
      now - the time to get the current period for.
      Returns:
      the current period object, if one exists. If now == null or no period exists as specified by now, then null is returned.

    • getNextPeriod

      public SchoolPeriod getNextPeriod(UTCTime now)
      Gets the period immediately after the period returned by getCurrentPeriod. This is achieved by taking the end time of the current period and adding 1 millisecond, thus causing the time to overflow to the start of the next period whose time is at least 1 millisecond.
      Parameters:
      now - the time to get the next period for.
      Returns:
      the next period object, if one exists. If the current period is null, now == null, or no next period exists, then null is returned.
      See Also:
      • getCurrentPeriod(util.UTCTime)

    • getNextPeriodToday

      public SchoolPeriod getNextPeriodToday(UTCTime now)
      Returns the period immediately after the period returned by getCurrentPeriod if the current period is not the last period.
      Parameters:
      now - the time to get the next period in the current day specified by now.
      Returns:
      the next period in the current day specified by the argument now. If now == null, the current period is null, or the current period is the last period in the day, null is returned.

    • getTimeRemaining

      public Duration getTimeRemaining(UTCTime now)
      Gets the time remaining. The range of the "remaining time" is started by the argument now and terminated by the end of the current period if currentPeriod.isCounted(), else the start of the next period that is counted. At most, the next calendar year is searched for a valid period before the method is exited with a null return value.
      Parameters:
      now - the time that starts the "remaining time" interval.
      Returns:
      the amount of remaining time.
      See Also:
      • SchoolPeriod
